content:
I am very new to lean, and was going through the book "An introduction to lean".

Is there a reason why functions seem to have the signature (p : α → Prop) [_inst_1 : decidable_pred p] rather than (p : α → bool).

Two examples that I found thus far are list.filter and char.is_punctuation.

"An introduction to Lean" is very out of date. You may want to look at Theorem Proving in Lean instead. In particular, stuff like [_inst_1 : decidable_pred p] is explained in the chapter on Type Classes.

There are also some easier sources to get into Lean; have you seen the Natural Number Game?
Thanks for the reply @Bryan Gin-ge Chen . Theorem Proving in Lean was next on my reading list. I know about the Natural Number Game but haven't tried it yet.
